title: We NEED To Talk About Once Human
author: Asmongold TV

key_facts: FACT: The game Once Human launched today after the creator spent approximately 100 hours in its beta phase.
FACT: The creator's internet was down all day, preventing them from playing the game initially.
FACT: Two developers of Once Human were met by the creator at the OTK Games Expo.
FACT: The developers confirmed that there is no gacha system or in-game purchase for skins in Once Human.
FACT: The game has a character creation limit of one per account and does not allow character deletion.
FACT: Server switching is currently not possible in the game.
FACT: The game's privacy policy has been criticized for lack of transparency and over-collection of personal data.
FACT: A security bug related to full PC access was reported but has since been fixed.
FACT: The game features a season pass and endgame shop with monetization elements.
FACT: The game's engine performance was described as sluggish and heavy during early playthroughs.
FACT: The game is free-to-play with live servers and continuous updates.
FACT: The game includes a PVE-focused server option, which the creator intends to join.
FACT: The game's tutorial features a siren, which the creator finds unnecessary and poorly designed.
FACT: The game's progression system includes grinding mechanics with resets every six weeks.
FACT: The game is developed by an Asian studio and marketed as a free-to-play title.
key_opinions: OPINION: The creator believes that concerns about privacy policies are invalid if players are already running Riot Games on their systems.
OPINION: The creator does not take privacy complaints seriously unless they involve direct government ties to the developer.
OPINION: The game feels more shallow and soulless than previous beta versions despite visual improvements.
OPINION: The creator values gameplay experience over technical or ethical concerns like data collection.
OPINION: Reviews criticizing non-gameplay aspects (e.g., loading screens) are still valid and justified.
OPINION: The game's monetization model is acceptable if it functions as a one-time purchase equivalent to a subscription.
OPINION: Pay-to-win is only problematic when spending directly correlates to power imbalance across tiers.
OPINION: The game is enjoyable regardless of negative reviews, especially for casual players seeking relaxation.
OPINION: The creator prefers a subscription-based model over microtransactions for long-term accessibility.
OPINION: The game's quality should be judged independently of community sentiment or toxic positivity.
OPINION: The game’s design choices reflect a focus on PVE over PVP, which aligns with the creator’s preferences.
OPINION: The game’s lack of server switching and character deletion is frustrating and illogical.
OPINION: The game’s AI and combat mechanics are underwhelming compared to other titles in the genre.
OPINION: The game’s monetization is fairer than many free-to-play games due to optional nature and value clarity.
OPINION: The game’s global accessibility justifies its free-to-play model despite regional economic disparities.
key_datapoints: DATA: Creator invested approximately 100 hours in the beta version of Once Human.
DATA: Game launch occurred on the same day as the stream.
DATA: Internet outage prevented gameplay for the entire day prior to streaming.
DATA: One character per account is allowed; character deletion is not supported.
DATA: Server switching functionality is currently unavailable.
DATA: A security bug involving full PC access was reported and later patched.
DATA: The game features a season pass and endgame shop with monetization elements.
DATA: Progression resets every six weeks, requiring repeated grinding.
DATA: Game engine performance described as sluggish and heavy during early testing.
DATA: Creator plans to play on the most populated PVE server for optimal experience.
DATA: The game is free-to-play with live servers and continuous updates.
DATA: The game includes a one-time purchase option that unlocks full features for a period.
DATA: Creator compares the monetization model to World of Warcraft’s subscription system.
DATA: The game’s tutorial includes a siren feature deemed unnecessary by the creator.
DATA: Creator notes massive stutters during gameplay on initial load.
